intro: Cleome ephemera, commonly known as the summer crown. This annual plant is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant has palmate leaves with three to five lobes, and its stems are hairy and branched. Cleome ephemera is relatively easy to grow from seed and is often used in ornamental gardens for its vibrant floral display.
